title: Java Developer
description:
Jobbify är en jobbplattform för vassa kandidater.
  
För kunds räkning har vi publicerat denna annons, vill du komma i kontakt med den slutgiltiga arbetsgivaren kan du klicka dig vidare till annonsen:
  
  

Assignment Description
  
  

Digg is on a mission to drive the digitalization of the public sector in Sweden forward. As part of this initiative, there are several ongoing efforts within Digg related to the Swedish e-identification system, both at the national level and in response to changes at the EU level. The government has announced its intention to develop a state e-identification, and in this context, Digg is seeking three Java Developers to provide expert consulting support. Experience in solutions with a strong emphasis on security is a key requirement for this role. The consultants will be primarily engaged in Digg's work to develop a state e-identification.
  
  

The assignment will involve close collaboration with stakeholders, UX designers, testers, and other developers involved in the design and development of software.
  
  

It is also possible that the consultant's expertise may be needed in other projects at Digg.
  
  

Required Skills
  
  

Experience in Java development, with a minimum of 5 years
  
  

Experience in microservice architecture, with a minimum of 1 year
  
  

Experience in the development of security features
  
  

Experience with Kubernetes
  
  

Experience with Quarkus, Springboot, or similar
  
  

Experience in team-based development according to agile principles
  
  

Fluent in Swedish (spoken and written) and good knowledge of English (spoken and written)
  
  

Preferred Skills
  
  

Experience in backend test automation
  
  

Experience in certificate management
  
  

Experience in automation of build, test, and delivery pipelines in container-based environments

Vill du läsa mer om tjänsten och vem vi söker - Klicka här!

title: Systemutvecklare inom Edge & IoT till TechSeed
description:
Jobbify är en jobbplattform för vassa kandidater.
  
För kunds räkning har vi publicerat denna annons, vill du komma i kontakt med den slutgiltiga arbetsgivaren kan du klicka dig vidare till annonsen:
  
På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.
  
TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt bolag som erbjuder konsulttjänster och har ett kompetensdjup inom flera domäner. Vi är på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker nu systemutvecklare som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt och tar ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Vi söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – Tillsammans.
  
  

Som Systemutvecklare kommer du arbeta som konsult i samarbete med kund. TechSeed strävar efter att kunna erbjuda en blandning mellan placering hos kund och projekt som leds av TechSeed. Respektive uppdrag sätter förutsättningarna och det förväntas att du är bekväm med båda alternativen.
  
  

I den här rollen kommer du tillhöra enheten TechSeed Edge & IoT Göteborg, vars fokus sträcker sig från vision till leverans av uppkopplade system. IoT och IIoT handlar till stor del om att fånga datapunkter från verkligheten. En verklighet där kundernas utmaningar omfattar helt olika processer och verksamheter. Kanske är det du som bygger lösningen för att säkerställa rätt temperatur i transportkedjan för kylda livsmedel. Kanske handlar nästa utmaning om Computer Vision och drönare för att läsa av förväntad avkastning och underhåll inom jord- och skogsbruk. Edge syftar på bearbetning av data nära källan, vilket styrs av krav på säkerhet, bandbredd och underhåll. Uppdragen kräver nära dialog med kund och förståelse för verksamhet och affärsmodell.
  
  

Som delägare och anställd kommer du vara med i utvecklingen av våra erbjudanden, få möjlighet att påverka de områden som du drivs av och samtidigt få tryggheten av ett team med gemensamt mål och gemensamma intressen.
  
  

Vår grund ligger i att vi delar med oss av vår passion för teknik och värdet vi skapar. Det handlar bland annat om kunskapsutbyte och att dela idéer, bidra med god stämning såväl som att skapa värde genom vårt delägarskap. Vi erbjuder dig:
  
  

Inflytande i hur vi bygger TechSeed tillsammans
  
  

En öppen kultur där vi värdesätter olikheter, insikter och innovationer
  
  

Direkt värde från våra finansiella resultat genom bonus och delägarskap
  
  

Möjligheten att växa in i olika tekniska områden / ansvarsområden utifrån dina önskemål
  
  

Flexibelt arbete hemifrån, beroende på uppdragets behov.
  
  

Vem söker vi?
  
  

Vi söker dig vars expertis är systemutveckling inom IoT / IIoT. Du har goda programmeringskunskaper i någon av de mer väletablerade språken, som exempelvis Java, C#, Python eller motsvarande.
  
  

Några exempel på tekniker och begrepp från vår vardag; AWS/GCP/Azure IoT, Bluetooth, CoAP, DDS, DevOps, Digital Twin, HMI, IT/OT, Linux, LoRaWAN, LTE CAT, LwM2M, Machine Learning, MES, Modbus, MQTT, NB-IoT, ONNX / PyTorch / Cuda, OPC UA, PKI, PLC, PROFINET, SCADA, Sparkplug, Wi-Fi, ZigBee.
  
  

Om delar av ovan är en del av din vokabulär, yrkeserfarenhet och fångar ditt intresse - hör av dig!
  
  

Du är såklart nyfiken på ny teknik, trivs i roller där du utvecklas och i en kultur där vi hjälps åt och bygger bolaget tillsammans. Du har minst 5 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet, är lösningsorienterad och trivs i samarbete med andra. Eftersom vi arbetar med flera typer av kunder med olika behov kräver rollen att du kan uttrycka dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att jobba på ett start/scale-up, har tidigare konsulterfarenhet eller relevanta kunskaper från industrivertikaler och marknadsområden.
  
  

Om TechSeed
  
  

Vi är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag i ScaleUp-fasen med visionen att skapa värde med uppkopplade lösningar. Vi tror på kombinationen av nära samarbeten, framtidens tekniker och att gemensamt arbeta för att skapa ett bolag vi verkligen trivs på. Genom att erbjuda delägarskap till våra anställda ger vi möjligheten till insyn och påverkan, samtidigt som det gynnar samarbeten och att prioritera vad som är bäst för gruppen. Detta speglas både i vår kultur och våra erbjudanden, där vi kombinerar vårt stora tekniska intresse med ett kundanpassat förhållningssätt samtidigt som vi har många sociala aktiviteter och en härlig gemenskap på kontoret. Vår arena är uppkopplade ekosystem, där tekniker som IoT och Intelligent Edge används för att skapa uppkopplade tjänster och system inom ekosystem som Smart Cities, Smart Factories, Smart Companies och Smart Buildings.

title: 2 Full Stack Developer Internships
description:
2 Full Stack Developer Internships
 



 Two 5-6 months internship positions at our office in Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





**Quick summary** 




  




* **Experience** 
 :
 
 Minimum of 1-2 years hands-on experience in web development
* **Skills** 
 : Practical knowledge of React JS, Redux, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, NodeJS, document databases, and/or REST API protocols
* **Time frame:** 
  Starting mid- to end of August. Minimum of 5 to 6 months.
* **Company** 
 : Established in 2015 with 10 employees, serving B2B clients in 10 countries
* **Products** 
 : Two web solutions - Soulcircus.se and Cruncho.com
* **Growth:** 
  Eager to learn and grow within a company poised for rapid expansion



  





**Embark on a tech journey with Dream Troopers** 




  





 Established in Stockholm in 2015, Dream Troopers AB, a small yet ambitious team of around 10 employees, emerges as an innovative multi-awarded tech company.
 



  





 We specialize in crafting SaaS whitelabel event calendars (
 **Cruncho Events** 
 ) and hyperlocal urban guides (
 **Cruncho Guides** 
 ), serving municipalities, tourism boards and local media. Our reach spans 10 countries, with Sweden leading the way. Last fall, Atout France and the French Ministry of Tourism officially selected our company’s solutions to cover the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games.
 



  





 But there's more - our innovation extends to our new B2C platform,
 **Soulcircus.se** 
 , connecting people and companies with a community of experienced teachers, healers and practitioners in the segment of wellness, alternative healing, and personal growth, all powered by our own tech. This new platform, first released in Sweden, is set to launch in other countries, with an ambitious goal to help build a better world.
 



  





**Position Overview** 




  





 Our company is seeking 
 
 2 Full Stack Developer Interns currently taking a Masters in Computer Science at KTH, Chalmers University, Stockholm University or similar, and 
 
 willing to learn and practice end-to-end development. Joining a close-knit team of 3 Full Stack Developers, composed of both professionals and Masters’ students from top engineering schools, you’ll collaborate closely with the CEO and Business Development team to shape our in-house projects.
 



 In this dynamic environment, your impact on Soulcircus and Cruncho’s success stories is clear, enhancing your own career journey in the process. Step into a realm of endless innovation where your talents can truly shine!
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  




* Development planning in collaboration with the tech team
* Continuous development and maintenance of Soulcircus and Cruncho’s frontend and backend apps - including a
 
 white
 
 label city guide and its CMS, an event calendar and its event manager, soulcircus.se including payment options, APIs and an admin module
* Work with databases and production data (querying, extracting reports, bulk updates, MongoDB, Elastic Search, etc.)
* Maintain a consumer-focused outlook and aid in the delivery of projects to market
* Troubleshoot irregularities and optimize performance
* Share responsibility of the product as a whole



  





**Requirements** 




  




* Currently taking a 
 **Master's degree** 
  in Computer Science or related field
* Minimum of
 **1-2 years' experience** 
 working hands-on with web development
* Practical knowledge in a variety of technologies including React JS, Redux, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Fastify, document databases, REST API protocols and responsive web UI
* Familiarity with the dynamics of the start-up ecosystem
* Familiarity using Scrum/Agile development methodologies
* Excellent verbal and written English communication. Swedish is a plus







 As an individual, you're a proactive self-starter, capable of working both collaboratively and with a high degree of independence. Your problem-solving and organizational skills and your attention to detail set you apart. You excel in challenging environments, finding joy in hands-on learning and consistently striving for improvement. You approach life with optimism, coupled with a healthy sense of humor. Your adeptness at fostering trust and cultivating lasting relationships is noteworthy.
 



  





**Extra Beneficial Qualifications** 




  




* Expertise in DevOps best practices, including adeptness with Docker containers
* Proficiency in Simple Analytics, Grafana, Google Analytics or other analytics platforms
* Skill in web scraping techniques
* Basic grasp of UI/UX design principles
* Aptitude in image editing software such as Figma, Sketch, Photoshop and more



  





**What we offer** 




  




* Engagement with a blooming enterprise within an exciting market
* A collaborative, creative and supportive work environment with a family feeling
* Room for personal and professional growth
* Access to an 80m2 private office in Stockholm providing a versatile co-working environment, an integrated yoga/meditation studio, complimentary breakfast and fruit offerings, and afterwork gatherings
* Embrace of flexible working hours, catering to individual work-life balance



  









**Positions available** 
 : 2
 



**Preferred commencement** 
 : mid- to end of August 2024
 



**Duration** 

 : 5 to 6 months (can be longer)
 




**Employment type** 
 : Full-time (40 hours per week)
 



**Compensation** 
 : Yes
 



**Location** 
 : Bromma, Stockholm, Sweden. Office within a business complex shared with other companies.
 



  





**How to apply** 




  





 If you're interested, please send along your CV via LinkedIn. Don't hesitate - the recruitment process is ongoing and we look forward to hearing from you soon!
 



 For more information or questions please contact us at hello@soulcircus.com. Feel free to learn more at cruncho.com and soulcircus.io.
 



  





 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
 



  





**Experience sharing from our colleagues:** 




  





 “
 *The amazing thing about working at Dream Troopers is that your ideas really, truly matter. To be involved for the entire development process requires a large serving of personal responsibility and excellent communication skills - but the payoff is huge. Dream Troopers is exciting, empowering and provides an endless catalyst for personal development, all while being surrounded by a diverse team of brilliant, kind and fun individuals.* 
 ”
 



  





 Tobias, UX- and Frontend Engineer
 







*“Dream Troopers is a place where you can put your ambitions and ideas into practice. I’m continuously developing my technical skills as well as how to better integrate my work with UX and business goals. I truly feel that the only limit to my growth is myself. Dream Troopers is a creative and progressive environment that nurtures talent.”* 




  





 Anders, Backend Developer and Data Scientist
 



  





*"When you are part of Dream Troopers, you are part of a team that consistently works together to produce the best work possible, while also ensuring each individual has the opportunity to grow and learn. The people at Dream Troopers trust each other inherently to reach the greatest solutions possible, and every idea is truly listened to and heard. This team is full of positivity and ambition, so if you want to grow in the best environment possible, Dream Troopers is the place for you!"* 




  





 Romain, Full Stack Developer
 



  





*"My time at Dream Troopers was an unforgettable experience. Not only did I grow both personally and professionally, but I also had the opportunity to discover Sweden along the way. At Dream Troopers, they pay particular attention to the well-being of each individual, which creates an atmosphere filled with good vibes and great energy. Every day was a blessing filled with new challenges and opportunities for creativity. The people at Dream Troopers work hard and believe in their vision, and given the chance, I’m sure you will too!"* 




  





 Mathéo, Full Stack Developer
 



  





**Welcome to Dream Troopers!**

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
Kundo är ett SaaS-bolag som erbjuder Nordens mest okrångliga kundservicelösning. Kundservice är en bransch i snabb förändring där ny teknik/AI har medfört stora möjligheter till innovation och effektivisering. Det innebär att vi har en spännande resa framför oss där vår produkt både ska byggas ut men också transformeras för att möta nya behov och de möjligheter som finns med AI.
 



 På vår fortsatta tillväxtresa letar vi efter dig som vill ansluta till vårt fantastiska produktutvecklingsteam som backend-utvecklare med kunskap och intresse för infrastruktur och drift.
 



 Denna roll kommer att bidra till att framtidssäkra vår plattform och möjliggöra våra AI-drivna initiativ, delta i utvecklingsprojekt, samt vidareutveckla och underhålla vår skalbar cloud-arkitektur och hantering av säkerhetslösningar. För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du har:
 



  




* Minst 5 år erfarenhet av webbutveckling
* Bred erfarenhet av produktutveckling i Python
* Djup kunskap av AWS infrastruktur och Infrastructure as code
* Känner dig trygg gällande DevOps praxis och har praktisk erfarenhet av mjukvaru-releaser (helst continous deployment)



  





**Om vår produkt** 




 Med vår produkt får våra kunder ett modernt och kraftfullt kundserviceverktyg att samarbeta i för att svara på alla ärenden som de får in. Med hjälp av vår produkt levererar organisationer i Norden en bättre kundserviceupplevelse till tiotusentals kunder varje dag.
 



 Flera miljoner meddelanden passerar genom våra system varje månad - och den siffran ökar hela tiden. Enkelheten i att använda våra tjänster är mycket uppskattat av våra kunder och något vi är stolta över.
 



 Undrar du vilka tekniker vi arbetar med? Här är de tekniker du kommer att arbeta med:
 



  




* Python - Django/FastAPI
* AWS (Kostnadsoptimering, Nätverk, IAM)
* Kubernetes
* Terraform
* MySQL
* Elastic Search



  





**Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?** 



* Små team med täta samarbeten inom och utanför teamet
* Högt lärande och delaktighet i alla delar av produktutvecklingen
* Goda förmåner som ett 32 dagars semester, kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr/år, pension (ITP-1) och privatvårdsförsäkring
* Hybrid-upplägg som möjliggör remotearbete 2 dagar/vecka
* Konferensresa varje höst, roliga teamaktiviteter och interna events, sommarfest och julbord, etc



  





 Har du några frågor? Vi berättar gärna mer! Hör av dig till Jonatan Larsson på 070-5124424 eller jonatan@kundo.se. Till denna tjänst tar vi ingen hjälp av partners, utan kommer att sköta processerna på egen hand internt.

title: Test developer in electrification
description:
Are you ready to be part of Scania's exciting electrification journey? With us, you have the opportunity to contribute to the development of electrified transport vehicles in a department that works with software development for many of the electrified systems. We are now looking for more test engineers who want to be part of this journey and shape the sustainable transport solutions of the future.
   

  

 In our team, we work closely together in an inclusive and creative environment. We help each other every day. Sometimes we work from home and sometimes from the office - it is flexible and driven based on needs, and we are on site approximately 50%. The team is mixed in both genders, ages and nationalities, we are innovative together in a open and friendly environment.
   

  

**The role of the Test Engineer**
 As a test engineer at Scania, you will develop a broad competence within the vehicle's control system and get an overview of how different functions work together in the software. Here you not only get the opportunity to use your creativity and innovative ideas, but also to find effective ways to verify and improve our products. At the group, we work specifically with software that controls charging, climatization, and auxiliaries in the vehicle. We also test cyber security of the software.
   

  

 Your tasks will include system testing of software, including requirements review, test case creation and creation of test scripts for automated tests. Testing will be performed both in test rigs (SIL and HIL) and in real vehicles (trucks and buses). The HIL rigs we work with are built by the group, so also practical work with minor reconstructions in the rigs is the group's responsibility. You will also be responsible for analyzing test results and constantly working to improve strategies and methods. Close collaboration with software developers and requirement writers is a natural part of your role to deliver high-quality products to our customers.
   

  

**Are you who we are looking for?**
 You can fit in with us both with a few years of experience in a similar role, as well as if you are a recent university/college graduate. We learn together and have, among other things, a journey towards ISO26262 certification ahead of us. You are responsible, structured, meticulous, and communicative and when it comes to making decisions together with the rest of us, you like to participate in the discussions. You can solve complex problems and enjoy challenging yourself and your colleagues to find creative solutions. Flexibility is a key skill, and you are ready to change focus when needed.
   

  

 To be qualified for this job you should have:
   

  

  

* A degree in electrical engineering, embedded systems, mechatronics or similar
* Knowledge of programming. For example Python, Capl and/or C.
* Experience with Git or similar.
* Understanding of embedded systems and basic electrical engineering.
* A European driving license for a car.
* English, both spoken and written.
* Swedish is good to master but not a requirement. However, we would like to see that in the future you want to take a truck driver's license and then, according to the current system, the theory test is in Swedish.


 Meritorious
   

  

  

* C and/or D driving licence
* Previous experiences from Scania/automotive/testing
* Vector-based programs such as CANoe and vTESTstudio


 At Scania, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles! We hire for attitude and train for skills.
   

  

**We offer**
 At Scania, we believe in your success and development. As part of our team, you will have access to fantastic development opportunities, work with professional colleagues, and be part of a revolutionary journey in the transport industry. We also offer benefits such as a staff car, performance bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, discounted lunch and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we even have our own direct bus that takes you to and from work.
   

  

**For more information**
 If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact me (Malin Petersén, recruiting manager and Assignment Manager) at malin.petersen@scania.com
   

  

 Your future starts here, at Scania – together for sustainable transport solutions!
   

  

**Application**
 If you feel that this description suits you and that the role of test engineer at Scania sounds exciting, do not hesitate to submit your application. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 2024-06-28. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We may use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!
   

  

 For more information about the company visit: www.scania.com.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Frostbite is EA’s state-of-the-art multi-platform game development engine. Our global team develops creative engine features and cutting-edge tools that let our game makers create stunning games. We’re honored to have thousands of game developers worldwide using Frostbite as they create some of the industry’s best-known titles and amazing player experiences. Join us as we help shape the future of gaming with Frostbite.
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our inclusive Frostbite Architecture Team that reports to Frostbite Head of Technology. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will ensure the stability, performance, and technical health of the Frostbite engine.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will work across the entire engine, including engineering investigations, unblocking technical issues, promoting best practices, and enhancing team productivity.
* You will work with teams to ensure the stability, performance, and technical health of the Frostbite engine. Provide guidance, troubleshoot issues, and foster best practices.
* You will create tools to maintain and track Frostbite engine quality, analyze data, monitor performance metrics, and enhance efficiency in game team development.
* You will identify risks and impediments within Frostbite and supporting teams. Help reduce tech debt, improve effectiveness, and propose solutions.
* You will stay updated with industry trends, evaluate new technologies, and propose improvements to Frostbite's architecture.


**Requirements**
* You have 7 years of experience as a Software Engineer, with a focus on software architecture, systems and performance.
* You have proficiency in C++ and C# programming languages.
* You have experience delivering projects using large-scale game engines or complex software systems.
* You have knowledge of using software development best practices in large teams.
* You have experience with gaming and a desire to push the boundaries of technology in the gaming industry.


 If you are an experienced Senior Software Engineer with experience in architectural design, performance optimization, and improving the technical health of game engines, we invite you to join our inclusive team. Help shape the future of Frostbite and deliver unparalleled gaming experiences.

title: Senior Software Engineer Java (Cloud Solutions)
description:
**Description**

  




**About Accedo** 

  




 Accedo is a global video solutions provider, pioneering some of the world’s most impactful multi-screen experiences. We enable video businesses of all shapes and sizes to continuously grow, evolve, and innovate their offerings across regions, platforms, and devices. We leverage our long standing experience and focus on innovation to create premium and engaging video experiences.
 
  




**Our team** 

  




 Within Accedo, Global Solutions is a team of highly motivated experts with domain knowledge in PayTV/Broadcast, OTT, and Cloud. We're looking for a skilled Senior Software Engineer to join the Global Solutions function. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be part of a diverse and multi-disciplined team, leveraging cutting edge technologies and working with well recognized global brands. The role involves working in a highly collaborative environment, interacting and providing guidance and thought leadership to internal and external stakeholders, formulating and implementing new solutions, driving the creation of prototypes, and further evolution of existing solutions.
 
  




**About The Position**

  




 We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer who will strengthen our Global Solutions team and contribute towards accelerating the work on our cloud platform, which encompasses back-end services, systems, and infrastructure that power our cloud solutions.
 
  




 Back-end services are primarily Java-based and cloud-native. We believe in a DevOps mindset, which for us means that we take full responsibility for developing and running the stack -- 'we build it and we run it'. You will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining large-scale, high availability back-end services, and own the platform infrastructure including managing cloud resources, build pipelines, and more. You will also be responsible for promoting a sound engineering culture through active technical leadership and hands-on development.
 
  




**What We Are Looking For**

  




 For this particular role, we're looking for candidates who have extensive experience with Java and running services at scale, built on top of a Public Cloud (preferably AWS). You should also have:
 
  




* Deep knowledge of Java and Java-related technologies
* Experience building secure and reliable high-concurrency systems with very strict high-availability and low-latency requirements
* Experience building systems running on top of AWS and utilizing a variety of cloud resources
* Solid application performance tuning experience
* Strong system / service development experience
* Solid understanding of engineering methodologies, practices, and tools
* Experience with a wide variety of back-end technologies, databases, and architecture, including their benefits and trade-offs
* Experience integrating open source and 3rd party APIs and libraries
* Ability to communicate clearly in English with technical and non-technical teammates
* Proven experience with live debugging and incident resolution



  




 Does this sound like it's up your alley? Let's have a chat.
 
  




 At Accedo, we are committed to fostering an environment of inclusiveness where employees are both valued and heard. Inclusion also means having diverse representation in gender, race, sex, thought, and other personal characteristics to contribute towards the betterment of our commerce and people. We strongly encourage applications from diverse communities to contribute towards our commitment of inclusivity.

title: Senior Growth Engineer
description:
**At Epidemic Sound we are reinventing the music industry. Our carefully curated catalog, with over 40,000 tracks, is tailored for storytellers, streaming services, and in-store soundtracks. Countless clients around the world, from broadcasters, production companies, DSPs, and YouTubers rely on our tracks to help them tell their stories. Epidemic Sound’s music is heard in hundreds of millions of online videos daily, across millions of playlist streams, and in thousands of in-store locations. Headquartered in Stockholm, we’re spread across offices in New York City, Los Angeles, Seoul, Hamburg, and Amsterdam. We’re growing fast, have lots of fun, and are taking the music industry with us.**
 We are looking for a Senior Growth Engineer to help us take our platform to the next level! The position is full-time and based in Stockholm.
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
 Acquisition is seeking an experienced Growth Engineer with a strong focus on frontend development and user acquisition/growth to join our team. You’ll play a vital role in optimizing our conversion rate and shaping the first impression of visitors' interaction with Epidemicsound.com. You’ll work on public pages, signup flows, and the necessary tools and infrastructure required for user acquisition.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Collaborate closely with product teams, SEO team, and Performance Marketing team to drive growth and conversion rate optimization
* Conduct A/B tests and analyze data to improve user experience
* Act as an architect, taking ownership of complex technical projects, including planning, cross-team collaboration, and impact evaluation
* Utilize your expertise in frontend web development technologies such as Typescript, React, Next.js, HTML, and CSS
* Leverage your experience in backend development, particularly in Python and/or frameworks like Django
* Fostering an inclusive and collaborative culture
* Embrace agile development processes, including pair and mob programming, to share knowledge


**What You’ll Bring**
* Experience from working as a fullstack developer, with focus on frontend development
* Strong knowledge using Typescript, React, HTML and CSS
* Experience from working with full stack frameworks like Django or Ruby on Rails.
* Strong interest in user growth, A/B testing, and interest and knowledge in experimentation and product analytics
* Experience working with web application performance, reliability, monitoring, and CI/CD


**It would also be music to our ears if you have/are:**
* Familiar with SEO practices
* Knowledge of CMS systems


**Most importantly**
 If you possess strong communication skills, a collaborative spirit, and a passion for personal and professional development, this is the opportunity you’ve been looking for. Join our team to work in an environment that fosters innovation and embraces diversity.
   

  

 Epidemic Sound, the market leading platform for restriction-free music, is headquartered in Stockholm, heard around the globe and on a mission to soundtrack the world.The company has democratized access to music for storytellers. Its innovative digital rights model paves the way for creators - everyone from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s largest brands - to use restriction-free music to take their content to the next level, whilst simultaneously supporting the musicians it works with both financially and creatively.The company was co-founded in 2009, operates across the globe, and has offices in five major cities: Stockholm, New York, Los Angeles, Seoul and Amsterdam. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital, Alecta. AMF, and TIN Fonder and its Chairperson is Andrew Fisher, former CEO and Chairman of Shazam.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Jobbify är en jobbplattform för vassa kandidater.
  
För kunds räkning har vi publicerat denna annons, vill du komma i kontakt med den slutgiltiga arbetsgivaren kan du klicka dig vidare till annonsen:
  
Kognic is on a mission to make everything that moves autonomous. We help AI product teams better understand their data by providing the best annotation platform for sensor-fusion datasets. We are an ambitious team building a global company together. We are now looking for someone to lead one of our development teams. Do you want to join us?
  
  

The Role
  
  

As the Engineering Manager for our Order Team, you lead, coach, and manage the team. You will work with a group of driven product developers skilled in backend and frontend development and UX design and interact with developers and stakeholders across the company.
  
  

The team owns our customers' user journeys and builds the APIs and applications for specifying and ordering data projects. It works with everything from data upload and conversion to authentication and authorisation, creating a composable foundation for client workflows. We build our SaaS product in React, Typescript, Scala, and Python on a cloud native foundation. The team owns the complete application lifecycle and is empowered to scope and slice increments to achieve a high velocity of valuable, viable, usable, and feasible increments. It works according to the DevOps principles, enabling focus on our products without building technical debt and hard-to-maintain software.
  
  

We expect you to work tactically and strategically and inspire the delivery of world-class products. You nurture our empowerment culture and guide the team to successful product outcomes. You will work closely with our product managers on the team's vision, goals, and roadmap, facilitating technical decisions and increment scoping.
  
  

You will be responsible for the employee lifecycle, including salary and performance review. We believe in empowered teams, and attracting and growing top-performing talents with various skill sets is vital to your success. We foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, empowerment, and trust in the team and that their objectives and missions inspire the delivery of a world-class platform. You will report to the VP of Engineering and be a member of the Engineering Management Team and the company’s extended management team.
  
We are looking for you!
  
  

We seek individuals who shine in technical and leadership contexts. Besides your development knowledge, we value that you are a team player with good communication skills, have a growth mindset, and value outcomes over activities.
  
Why Kognic?
  
  

We are in it to win and have a lot of fun while doing it! To be part of Kognic is to be part of a purpose-driven company with strong values where we create together what Kognic will be tomorrow. Besides working with around 120 talented and humble people from many different nationalities in a fun and creative environment, we also have many other great benefits!
  
  

Working in the exciting field of AI and playing an important part in the world’s next great technological leap
  
  

A hybrid work model and an employer that prioritises life-work balance
  
  

Lots of team and office events, parental pay, salary exchange, excellent health benefits, order your computer, place your pension—to name a few
  
  

From our early days as a start-up to our current life as a scale-up, we work in a dynamic environment, which means that every day might be different from the next, but that is precisely how we want it. Kognicians all have a strong desire to explore uncharted territory and a willingness to learn constantly.
  
  

Join us!
  
  

We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible. We select and perform interviews continuously. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact our VP of Engineering, Jakob Andersson, at jakob.andersson@kognic.com.
  
About Kognic
  
  

Kognic was conceived in the curious minds of Daniel Langkilde and Oscar Petersson, two engineers who dared to dream big and help machines make sense of our messy, chaotic, and unstructured world. Kognic's pioneering annotation solution helps companies accelerate the development of high-performing and trusted AI products, focusing on bringing the most advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) and autonomous driving (AD) to market.

title: UI Engineer - AI/Machine Learning Integration
description:
**Do you love building user interfaces that bring complex data to life? Are you passionate about machine learning and its potential to revolutionise user experiences? If so, then we want to hear from you!**
**We are seeking a talented UI Engineer to join our team and play a pivotal role in integrating our cutting-edge machine learning models with our core SaaS platform. You will be responsible for translating model outputs into clear, actionable insights through a visually appealing and intuitive user interface.**
***We have the data - come work with us!***
 The world is changing in the way we consume products, from ownership to usership, and DigitalRoute is positioned in the centre of the transition. Because, when enterprises pivot to usage-based business models, they often make an unfortunate discovery. Their systems weren’t built to handle the massive data volumes and complexity that usage-based models generate. This causes them to leak revenue and respond too slowly to customer demand. DigitalRoute solves this by creating a real-time usage data layer for enterprises. Our products transform raw usage data into clear information for billing, in real time and at high scale.
   

  

 At DigitalRoute we are shifting our focus from moving data at scale to delivering new insight and value out of the data we process. We call this Usage Intelligence: anomaly detection, usage forecasting, churn prediction, etc.. This new value creation heavily relies on artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Collaborate with Product Managers and Data Scientists to understand machine learning model functionalities and outputs.
* Design and develop user interfaces for integrating machine learning model APIs with the existing SaaS platform.
* Translate complex model results into clear and actionable visualizations using dashboards and other UI elements.
* Ensure seamless integration with the platform's native UI and user experience for a cohesive feel.
* Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code using modern front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
* Conduct thorough testing across different browsers and devices to ensure optimal performance.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in UI/UX design and machine learning visualization techniques.


**What You'll Bring**
* 3+ years of experience as a UI Engineer or in a similar front-end development role.
* Proven ability to design and develop user interfaces that are both visually appealing and user-friendly.
* Self-driven, opinionated, and autonomous work ethic.
* Strong understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (including frameworks like React, Node).
* Experience with integrating APIs and data visualization libraries.
* Familiarity with machine learning concepts and a passion for its potential applications.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
* A meticulous eye for detail and a commitment to writing clean and well-documented code.
* Experience with GitHub and GitHub CI/CD processes.
* Experience with building dashboards and data visualization tools.
* Knowledge of accessibility best practices.
* Understanding of SaaS development principles and familiarity with at least one of the major cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure, OCI)


 We apply continuous selection, and the position may be filled before the last application date.
   

  

 DigitalRoute wants to be part of an inclusive and diverse environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or age. You will be part of a global and diverse company where our differences are our strengths.
   

  

**We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, along with the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology that is making a real impact. If you are a talented UI Engineer who is excited to push the boundaries of human-machine interaction, then we encourage you to apply!**

title: Systemtekniker Windows server
description:
**Om jobbet**
-------------


Nu har du chansen att bli en av våra systemtekniker i teamet som sköter driften och underhåll av Trafikverkets Windowsmiljöer.


Du ingår i ett kvalificerat datacenterteam som producerar tjänster med hög kvalitet inom server, nätverk, lagring och backup. Du och dina kollegor ansvarar för att installera och härda Windows serveroperativsystem samt att felsöka och åtgärda eventuella uppkomna problem. Du kommer att arbeta självständigt med stort ansvar och ha dagliga kontakter med resten av teamet, övriga team, förvaltare och leverantörer. I arbetet kan dagjourarbete med en dispatcherroll samt beredskap på kvällar och helger förekomma.


Vad vi kan erbjuda dig:


Vi vill att det ska gå bra för dig och vi kommer ge dig en gedigen introduktion så att du kommer in i jobbet väl. Du kommer få en mentor som stöttar dig och dina grymma kollegor på enheten kommer att finnas där för att stödja dig och dela med sig av sina erfarenheter och bidra till din fortsatta utveckling.


Våra medarbetare trivs hos oss och har meningsfulla arbetsuppgifter, vilket avspeglas på olika undersökningar, där vi rankats som en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare.

**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------

**Vem är du?**

För att lyckas i rollen har du en god kommunikationsförmåga som innebär att du är lyhörd och anpassar din kommunikation till mottagaren. Du är en social person med god samarbetsförmåga som även trivs att arbeta självständigt. Du har god problemlösningsförmåga som gör att du identifierar problem och utvecklar lösningar ur ett helhetsperspektiv. Slutligen är du vetgirig och drivs av att utveckla vilket bidrar till att organisationen når sina mål och skapar nytta.

  

Vi söker dig som

* har minst ett års yrkeserfarenhet inom drift av Windows server On premises 2016 eller senare version
* har teknisk utbildning på minst gymnasienivå alternativt annan utbildning i närtid som vi bedömer likvärdig
* har goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift
* har läsförståelse i engelska

  

Det är meriterande om du

* har arbetslivserfarenhet och/eller teoretisk kunskap om Windows kluster
* har kunskap och arbetslivserfarenhet av Wmware, backup och Active Directory, AD.
* har erfarenhet av att arbeta med Powershell-script
* har erfarenhet av arbete i en agil organisation
**Övrig information**
---------------------


Möjliga placeringsorter är Borlänge, Gävle, Göteborg, Stockholm.


Önskar du att arbeta delvis på distans? I den här tjänsten finns det möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån upp till 40 procent av din arbetstid.


På Trafikverket finns ett aktivt fritidsförbund som erbjuder olika former av fritidsaktiviteter för anställda och deras familjer.


Som anställd på Trafikverket har du möjlighet till ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag. Det innebär att du kan få bidrag för aktiviteter inom motion och friskvård. Du har även möjlighet till förmånscykel som anställd. Vi vill inspirera till ökat och säkert cyklande med fokus på vår vision smidigt, grönt och tryggt.

**Ansökan**
-----------


De frågor som du får besvara när du skickar in din ansökan kommer att ligga till grund för det första urvalet vi gör. Urvalstester kommer att användas i denna rekrytering. Om det inte står något annat i annonsen vill vi att du bifogar ditt CV. Vi har slutat begära in personligt brev eftersom vi inte har med det som del av urvalsunderlaget.


Inom vår IT-organisation är du med och utvecklar Sverige med hjälp av moderna och innovativa lösningar. Vi är mitt i en spännande förändring där vi försöker ta vara på digitaliseringens möjligheter till fullo. Digitaliseringen ställer allt större krav och vi vill därför anpassa oss vad gäller kompetens, arbetssätt och organisation i takt med utvecklingen. Vi har ett helhetsansvar för IT och telekom, en verksamhet som pågår dygnet runt, året om - precis som Sveriges transportsystem.


På Trafikverket jobbar vi med att göra Sverige närmare. Vi tror på att en förening av olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och perspektiv är den bästa grunden för att bygga en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering och en miljö där alla trivs och gör sitt bästa. Vi tror på mångfald där den gemensamma nämnaren är pålitlighet, engagemang och mod. För det är så vi bäst representerar vårt samhälle.
company_description: Trafikverket ansvarar för långsiktig planering av transportsystemet för vägtrafik, järnvägstrafik, sjöfart och luftfart.

title: Kommunikation- och nätverkstekniker
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
--------------------


Nu har du chansen att bli en av oss!
  

  

IT-driften i Ronneby kommun är centraliserad och vi arbetar från Stadshuset. Vi är totalt 11 personer som har ansvar för all IT-drift i kommunen och dess kommunala bolag.
  

  

Vi arbetar tillsammans med hjärta och kvalitet för att kunna ge bästa möjliga service till Ronneby kommuns invånare. Ronneby ligger vackert mellan hav och skog i mitten av Blekinge. Dessutom har vi bra kommunikationer med bil, tåg och flyg.
  

Dina 2500 blivande kollegor är duktiga på att möta framtidens utmaningar och våra invånares ökade förväntningar genom digitalisering, samarbete och ett engagerat ledarskap.
  

  

Tillsammans med dig gör vi Ronneby ännu bättre!
  

  

Vi erbjuder dig:
  

En spännande tjänst där du får vara med och forma framtidens IT-miljö för Ronneby kommun och dess tre kommunala bolag. Tjänsten innehåller arbetsuppgifter med stor bredd, där du får vara med i hela processen från start till mål. Du får en personlig pott med kompetensutvecklingspengar som gör att du hela tiden kan utveckla dig själv och därmed även enheten. Varje vecka förfogar du över en friskvårdstimme och har möjlighet att använda flexarbetstid. När du börjar hos oss kommer du att få gå bredvid den person som haft tjänsten och nu ska gå i pension samt en annan kommunikationstekniker.


**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------


Du och en kollega är tillsammans ansvariga för vår nätverksmiljö som innehåller bland annat 350st Cisco switchar, 1000 st Aruba accesspunkter, Fortigate säkerhetsprodukter och mycket annat.
  

Förutom utveckling och underhåll av nätverksmiljön kommer du ingå i teamet som har hand om sista linjens support mot våra användare inom IT-kommunikationsfrågor.


**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


Då utvecklingen går väldigt snabbt inom IT, anpassar du dig fort till förändringar och nya utmaningar. Vidare är du nytänkande och tror på dig själv och din förmåga, vilket gör att du tar eget ansvar och är uppgiftsfokuserad när du tar dig an våra svåraste ärenden.
  

  

Du har en IT-utbildning på eftergymnasial nivå eller har arbetat med liknande arbetsuppgifter i några år.
  

B-körkort är ett krav.
  

  

Meriterande är kunskaper Fortinet, Aruba och Ciscos produkter.
  

Även om ovanstående är mycket viktigt lägger vi störst vikt vid din personliga lämplighet.


**Anställningens omfattning**
-----------------------------


Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning

  

Omfattning: Heltid

  

**Ansökan**
-----------


Ansök senast: 2024-08-18


Referensnummer: A1302369-2024-8

  

**Anställning**
---------------


Antal annonserade arbetstillfällen: 1

  

**Kontakt**
-----------


### **Kontaktperson**


Tobias Ekberg  

Chef för Service- och Digitaliseringsenheten  

0457618111  

tobias.ekberg@ronneby.se
### **Facklig företrädare**


Helena Carlberg Andersson  

Vision  

0457-618143  

helena.carlbergandersson@edu.ronneby.se
**Övrigt**
----------


Ronneby kommun krigsplacerar all tillsvidareanställd personal.
  

  

Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.
  

 Frågor om hur du ansöker och lägger in ditt CV ställer du till Visma Recruit 0771-10 10 29.
  

  

En ansökan till Ronneby kommun är en allmän handling och dina personuppgifter hanteras enligt GDPR.

title: Service Development Manager
description:
**Contracted Services and Services Sales Department**
 Scania is now transforming from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 Sales and Marketing is responsible for our customer offer and business strategy for Trucks, Bus, Power Solutions, Parts and Services, as well as sales support. Global support and IT applications are provided to the Scania-owned as well as to the independent franchise network creating the right conditions for an efficient retail and wholesale operation.
   

  

 Scania is currently undergoing an exciting digital transformation towards a more flow-oriented, customer-driven, digitalized and lean approach with agile methods and high-performance development teams as key components. - Now is the right time to join us on this exciting journey.
   

  

**Contracted Services and Services Sales Department** 
 is looking for a new team member with a focus on developing Scania’s Services business concerning services sales, related processes, methods, system support and global business concepts to support our retail operation with the right conditions to fulfil their full potential to achieve Scania’s business targets.
   

  

 The work will be carried out in cross-functional groups with agile methodology as a base and in close cooperation with Commercial Operations (CO), Presales & Sales Readiness (KJ), Business Unit’s Distributors, and internal departments.
   

  

**Your tasks**
* Drive the development of Services Sales methodologies (Retails Sales Management – Services), business processes within service sales and administration.
* Drive demands and put requirements on related systems e.g. SCRM, Digital Dealer, quotation tools etc, with high focus on the user journeys and the customer experience.
* Contribute with a sales perspective on a Global Services concepts in how we promote, educate, sell and package our services.
* Implementation projects together with CO and BU’s with regards to service business concepts, work methods, and process changes (e.g. Scania ProCare, Retail Sales Management – Services, Services 360).
* Together with CO representatives create services sales reference groups to maintain a continuous outside perspective on services sales development needs.
* Act as a representative for the Service Operation area in cross-functional projects to secure a services sales perspective on our services development projects.
* Define measuring methods, references and tools for service sales performance follow-up.


**Your profile**
* You have a commercial- and open-minded perspective on Scania’s service business, its operation, IT systems and our customer transport business.
* You are a good listener, communicative and have experience in driving change and improvements.
* We are looking for a person with experience in Service Operations, previous work in our Business Unit/Retail network is a merit.


 The implementations are done by Commercial Operation together with our service network, in close cooperation with our department and therefore you need good personal skills and the ability to support the implementation of both products and systems. You will also be required to act as a trainer and partner towards our services network, together with Commercial Operations.
   

  

**The team**
 Within Sales & Marketing we are a team of 8 employees consisting of Contract Development Managers, and Service Development Managers committed to enhancing the development of the services sales business in our network. As a Service Development Manager, you will be able to work with an experienced team supporting the global services organisation to achieve the best possible performance by developing service products and effective methods. Besides that, you will also be in a group that will highly support you and where you can broaden your knowledge within the Services Sales Business, including Contracted Services.
   

  

**For more information, please contact**
 Pedro Costa: +46 72 145 15 37, Head of Contracted Services and Services Sales (KYOA).
   

  

**Application**
 We are looking forward to reading your application, please apply by the 28th of June at the latest.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Dokumentcontroller
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Vill du jobba för att Stockholm ska bli världens mest hållbara stad? Vi är Sveriges ledande vatten- och avfallsbolag som varje dag tar ansvar för stockholmarnas och miljöns bästa i allt vi gör, både nu och för kommande generationer. Tillsammans arbetar vi för att Stockholm ska bli världens mest hållbara stad.
   

  

 Är du den som kan hjälpa oss att lyfta bolagets informationshantering? Vi söker dig som kan svara på frågor från medarbetarna om allmänna handlingar, informationshantering, bevarande, gallring och diarieföring.
   

  

 Informationshantering är en viktig och prioriterad del av vår verksamhet och vi behöver stärka upp vårt team för att möta verksamheternas behov. Som dokumentcontroller ingår du i Säkerhets- och informationsenheten och du rapporterar till teamledare. Tillsammans med ditt team hjälper du bolaget med informationshanteringsfrågor genom att skapa förutsättningar för ett bra arbete och du arbetar aktivt med att följa upp att lagkrav efterlevs gällande säker och långsiktig hantering av information. Teamet består av sex medarbetare i rollerna arkivarie, IT-arkivarie, dokumentcontrollers och en teamledare.
   

  

 Din huvudsakliga arbetsplats är på vårt kontor i Ulvsunda, men arbete förekommer även på våra andra anläggningar och kontor. Du har möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 50% efter överenskommelse med närmsta chef.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som dokumentcontroller har du en viktig roll i att ta hand om företagets material och göra det sökbart och säkrat. Du verkar som stöd till alla bolagets verksamheter och anläggningar vid deras frågor om informationshantering. Du har därmed en nyckelfunktion när det kommer till att stötta verksamheten med alltifrån rådgivning till utbildning och handledning inom informationshantering och dataskydd.
   

  

 Som en del i det dagliga arbetet kommer du hantera uppgifter såsom att:
   

  

* Diarieföra analog post och arkivlägga handlingar
* Bevaka vår funktionsbrevlåda för inkommande e-post för att snabbt kunna ta hand om eller vidarebefordra inkommande e-post
* Skapa ärenden i Platina, samt söka fram handlingar analogt i arkivet eller digitalt
* Samordna utlämnande av allmän handling


 Därutöver kommer du utföra kvalitetsinsatser inom registrering och ordnande av allmänna handlingar i enlighet med gällande lagar och regelverk. I ditt ansvar ingår även att stötta i framtagandet av informationshanteringsplaner och andra dokument som berör diarieföring, samt delta i beredande och implementerande av styrande och redovisande dokument på informationshanteringsområdet (till exempel informationsredovisning). Vid behov deltar du även i aktuella projekt.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:
   

  

* Högskoleutbildning inom arkiv- och informationsvetenskap eller motsvarande relevant erfarenhet från tidigare anställning
* God kunskap om de legala krav som påverkar informationshanteringen i stort, i både fysiska och digitala processer
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med arkiv- och registratur i offentlig verksamhet
* Goda kunskaper i Svenska språket givet arbetets karaktär


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du dessutom har erfarenhet av informationshanteringsarbete med säkerhetsskyddsklassade handlingar och god kunskap om innebörden av Dataskyddsförordningen (GDPR) och dess tillämpningsområden.
   

  

 I den här rekryteringen lägger vi även stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Vi ser värdet av din förmåga att lösningsorienterat hitta lösningar på uppkomna problem där möjligheterna är i fokus. Du är även en lagspelare som har lätt att samarbeta med andra och anpassa dig för att hitta win-win-scenarion i strävan mot gemensamma mål. Du visar prov på god självledarförmåga och har ett inre driv, samt är trygg i att stå upp för dina åsikter i främmande sammanhang.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Bra för dig att känna till är att vi kommer att annonsera under sommaren och urval sker från mitten av augusti.
   

  

 För oss är medarbetarnas hälsa i fokus. Vi underlättar för dig att göra hälsosamma val och att kunna kombinera arbete, fritid och familj. Vi erbjuder därför många av våra medarbetare förmånligt flextidsavtal och möjlighet att jobba hemifrån. Läs mer om oss på vår hemsida svoa.se/jobb.
   

  

 För att matchningen oss emellan ska bli så bra som möjligt har vi valt att jobba med rekryteringstester i vår urvalsprocess. Då vi är en arbetsgivare som värnar om och strävar efter en trygg arbetsmiljö för våra medarbetare och vår samhällsviktiga funktion, kommer du som slutkandidat att genomföra ett drogtest hos vår hälsopartner.
   

  

 Då du i din tjänst kommer att arbeta med säkerhetsklassad information, innebär det att även säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll kommer att genomföras i samband med anställning.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Group manager
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

**Lead Innovation at Scania**
 Are you knowledgeable about SCANIA’s design process and methods? Do you enjoy collaboration and interacting with people? Do you want to lead in a global context?
   

  

 Join us in driving innovation and transformation at Scania and within TRATON!
   

  

 As the Group Manager for CAD/vPDM Processes and Systems, you will lead dynamic teams responsible for ensuring the optimal use of our CAD/vPDM platforms, including Catia/Enovia, 3Dexperience, and Capital.
   

  

**About Us**
 Our trucks, buses, and power solutions are developed in our CAD platform by the designers in our R&D departments. Our aim is to create the best possible experience for our users, placing them at the center when we develop our methods, processes, and systems.
   

  

**Our assignment**
 We are responsible for strategy, methods, and tools for the virtual description of Scania’s products and deliver global solutions to support product development at Scania and within TRATON. We work collaboratively with business and IT in a Value Creation Team (VCT), where we also have members from other brands in our TRATON family. Within the area of CAD and vPDM, we see increasing demands going forward, and we are looking for additional leaders to shape the area.
   

  

**Your Role**
* Lead and support knowledge and committed employees in their cross-functional work to achieve the CAD/vPDM VCT mission and goals
* Be a part of the CAD/vPDM VCT management team and act as a coach for one or more VCT delivery teams.
* Contribute actively to the development the CAD/vPDM VCT.


**Your Profile**
* Strong knowledge of Scania’s product development processes and knowledge about how to work with modularisation.
* Proven experience in management teams, project management of large projects, or other leadership roles.
* Excellent communication skills in English; knowledge of Swedish and German is a plus.
* Familiarity with Catia/Enovia and 3Dexperience is a plus.


 We value a positive attitude, responsibility, and strong collaborative skills. As we work in a global context both geographically and across different brands, we seek someone with strong cultural awareness who can navigate complex situations with a visionary mindset. If you are driven, committed, and unpretentious, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

**Why Scania?**
 We offer an engaging and challenging role where innovation is encouraged. Our corporate culture values openness, diversity, and respect for the individual. We invest in our employees’ training and skill development to foster growth opportunities.
   

  

 As a Scania employee, you’ll enjoy benefits such as employee car options, performance bonus, flexible working hours, subsidized lunch, and more. For those residing in Stockholm, we provide direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.
   

  

 Apply now and be part of a team that values your contributions and supports your development.
   

  

**For more information**
 If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact:
   

  

 Sofia Karlgård Fräjdin, Senior manager EYMD, + 46 8 553 893 16
   

  

**Application**
 Welcome to apply latest by June 24th 2024 by answering some questions and by attaching your CV and any copies of relevant certificates. Selections will be made on
   

  

 an ongoing basis throughout the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Junior Business Controller
description:
**About The Opportunity**
**Are you ready to join our pink army as our new Junior Business Controller? Probably you feel extra excited when you get to combine your passion for finance with your analytical and business minded skills. Besides being part of our fast paced (cool) tech company, you will also dig deep into data that will have an impact on our business. If you feel ready to share your inner finance-nerd with us, this is the time to take the chance and apply!**
**Your mission:**
* Gain insight into forecasting, monthly closing and reporting
* Perform actual vs budget follow-ups and analyze monthly results
* Analyze drivers of deviations within assigned cost centers
* Support the team in producing data and reports linked to financial impact
* Assist in monthly closing and best estimate process
* Assist with different lucanet reporting tasks
* Working closely with different business areas such as Marketing, Service Operations and SG&A (Sales, General and Admin that is!) in terms of cost control
* Point of contact and finance business partner for our exciting New verticals (Concepts, Tabsquare and LAAS)


 We are looking for a
 **true foodorian** 
 who enjoys working in a
 **fast paced** 
 environment and dares to go further. To thrive in this role we believe that you are
 **responsible** 
 and take a huge
 **ownership** 
 of your work. We are looking for someone
 **analytical** 
 who has logical thinking skills and a structured approach to complex problems. If you also have a
 **business mindset,** 
 we probably are a match!
   

  

 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

**Our recruitment process will include the following:**
 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
   

  

 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and show us your skills!
   

  

 ✔️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
   

  

**Start date:** 
 Upon agreement
   

  

**What you need to be successful**
* Degree in, for example, Business and/or Economics, Engineering, Business Administration, Mathematics, Systems Science or similar
* You have approximately 1-4 years of experience working in finance or other analytical roles
* You have previous experience and feel comfortable working with Excel. Tableau, Anaplan, Looker, Planacy and Big Query is a plus!
* You can communicate fluently in English and Swedish both verbally and writing


 Studies have shown that women and some minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you are interested in this role and you have most of the skills we’re looking for, we encourage you to apply anyway!
   

  

**Who we are**
**foodora is a quick commerce and delivery company, present in eight countries in Europe - Austria, Czech, Denmark, Hungary, Finland, Norway, Sweden and Slovakia. With the mission to deliver an amazing, fast and affordable experience, foodora aims to give customers more time to focus on what matters most to them, as well as growing along with their partners, riders and community along the way. foodora is part of Delivery Hero, a pioneer quick commerce company, building the next generation of e-commerce across its operations in over 70 countries across Asia, Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa.
   

  

 For more information, please visit www.foodora.com
   

  

 foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide**
**What's in it for you**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora such as free group training at Sats & reduced price on massage.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and inspiring courses within our learning tool Sana
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Lead, Performance Operations
description:
**About The Opportunity**
**Are you a skilled analyst with a passion for leadership and a strong desire to join one of Sweden's fastest-growing tech companies? We are currently seeking a Manager for our Logistics Performance team who will be responsible for ensuring the seamless operation of our rider organization. This includes predicting order volumes across Sweden, optimizing rider staffing, scheduling, and leading an impactful team. If this opportunity has you excited, keep reading below for more details.**
**What You Will (but Not Only) Do**
* Manage a team of four direct reports who are responsible for the logistics operations performing at their best
* Analyze and draw conclusions from data to optimize and continually improve the way of working
* Responsible for integrating and packaging data to adapt it to relevant stakeholders
* Work operationally in the business at a detailed level to quickly capture any improvements
* Run projects with the objective of streamlining, expanding the business geographically and increasing the operational performance
* Support to the Swedish management by continuously working proactively with analyzes of data and identifying areas for improvement


 In the role, you report directly to the Operations Director and you will be a part of the Operations management team.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* Communication skills - To succeed in the role of Head of Performance Operations, you are communicative in your presentation of data
* Business mindset - have a good business understanding and can see to the strategic
* Analytical - You have an analytical and structured way of working and logical thinking skills and a structured approach to complex problems
* Problem-solving - You have a sense of urgency, pragmatism, and a solution-oriented approach to problem-solving


**Qualifications**
* University or higher education preferably within a technical field such as civil engineering
* 4+ years working experience within a similar position
* Experience of working in Excel Google Suite
* Experience of working in SQL
* Experience of BI tool such as Tableau or power BI or similar
* Basic understanding of accounting and finance is advantageous
* R, Python, MatLab, Java, C#, ETL, datbase infrastructure is advantageous
* Fluent English in speech and writing
* Fluent Swedish is advantageous


 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

**Our recruitment process will include the following:**
**💡** 
 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 💻 Digital HR interview - Let’s get to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and meet us face to face.
   

  

 💌 Reference check - Almost there!
   

  

 ✔️ Background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora such as free group training at Sats & reduced price on massage.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and inspiring courses within our learning tool Sana
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!


**Who We Are**
 We’re foodorians, a driven and happy gang of food lovers eager to create the LMD\* service of the future! Our core values help concretize what we’re aiming for:
 *We dare, We get it done & We’re equally pink* 
 . We’re people from all backgrounds, with different experiences, opinions and ideas. This is something we value highly, since we fully believe that diversity is what builds our culture and success.
   

  

 Success is fun, but let’s be clear: it cannot happen at the expense of sustainability. Since January 2020 we’re a carbon neutral business and we hope to lead the way for sustainability within our industry - from supplying 100% electrical transportation to promoting more environmentally friendly food choices. Please check out our Instagram, lifeatfoodora\_se, to see what’s going on right now.
   

  

* LMD = Last Mile Delivery. That, and many other nerdy abbreviations, is something you’ll learn when you start. ;)


**What you need to be successful**
* University or higher education preferably within a technical field such as civil engineering
* 4+ years working experience within a similar position
* Experience of working in Excel Google Suite
* Experience of working in SQL
* Experience of BI tool such as Tableau or power BI or similar
* Basic understanding of accounting and finance is advantageous
* R, Python, MatLab, Java, C#, ETL, datbase infrastructure is advantageous
* Fluent English in speech and writing
* Fluent Swedish is advantageous


**Who we are**
 ABOUT FOODORA: foodora is a quick commerce and delivery company, present in eight countries in Europe - Austria, Czech, Denmark, Hungary, Finland, Norway, Sweden and Slovakia. With the mission to deliver an amazing, fast and affordable experience, foodora aims to give customers more time to focus on what matters most to them, as well as growing along with their partners, riders and community along the way. foodora is part of Delivery Hero, a pioneer quick commerce company, building the next generation of e-commerce across its operations in over 70 countries across Asia, Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa.
   

  

 For more information, please visit www.foodora.com
   

  

 foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide

title: Group Manager - VCF Enablement team within Group Solution Development Enablement (GSDE)
description:
Scania, as part of Traton, is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

**The position and the group**
*Do you want to be a part of shaping the future of the TRATON R&D, leading the digital journey and at the same time securing the modular system? Then we have an unique opportunity for you!*
 We are looking for a Group Manager that can ensure the flow capacity and capability for the team on Value Creation Flow level when the Scania and TRATON’s future processes, information & IT landscape continue developing. The group covers solutions, architecture and flow at the VCF level.
   

  

 The group is responsible for:
   

  

  

* Create clarity in the vision & mission for the VCF and secure awareness of overall strategy fulfilment
* Owning, ensuring prioritization and updating the VCF backlog so that it is transparent and clear to all stakeholders
* Coach the VCTs in continuously improving the flow of value and advocate a lean agile mindset and culture
* Facilitate VCF events like pre and post-PI Planning and Solution demos
* Drive relentless improvement via Inspect and Adapt workshops
* Lead and guide the organisation in how to set new business architecture and processes in the transformation together with stakeholders from all over Scania and the other brands within TRATON.


 You will be the key player in coaching and developing the leadership triad of the Value Creation Flow and the Flow Initiative Owners and you will help improvements going forward. You will have the opportunity to work in a team focusing on leading the agile transformation, forming the VCF level together with the VCT:s. The group consists of senior members with long experience. We succeed and fail together. You will be part of the EYM department management team.
   

  

**About You**
 You have been working as a leader for more than 5 years. You have a strong customer focus and agile mindset combined with a solid experience with the processes, information and IT landscape within Scania supporting the modular system.
   

  

 You can understand, apply and convey the Scania and Traton business strategies.
   

  

 As a person, you are a driven, flexible, servant leader and team player able to work with everyone in the organisation. A condition is that you are interested in people, have good communication skills and that you want to share knowledge with others.
   

  

 You probably have an academic degree in Engineering or Computer Science.
   

  

 It is meriting if you have worked with cross-company or cross-organizational collaboration.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* Enable flow: Removing obstacles, coaching and mentoring the flow. Go to the flow to stay informed and guide.
* Career growth and personal development for your team members
* Supporting and strengthening lean-agile methodology
* Facilitate innovation and improvements in the team
* Ensure effective design practices, design guidelines and competence development
* Give input on budget and capacity need


**We offer**
* A once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to participate in the design of an automotive global champion with more than 100 000 employees.
* The chance to learn about the newest technologies in an agile environment
* Be part of an agile transformation journey
* A hybrid working mode, with high flexibility of combining remote and office work


 As a Scania employee, in addition to career and development opportunities, you will be offered other benefits such as a company car, a performance bonus, an occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices and much more. If you live in Stockholm we also provide a direct bus between Stockholm and Södertälje via Scania Job Express.
   

  

**For more information**
 Please contact Michael Thel, Engineering Director, +46 855381694
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 30 June 2024. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 If you think this sounds like a nice challenge, please apply!

title: Data Domain Owner - Finance
description:
Join Our Team as an Information & Data Domain Owner!
   

  

 Are you passionate about data governance and eager to drive transformation in the finance sector? Look no further! At Scania’s Finance Way and Innovation Office, we’re searching for a seasoned and dynamic professional to take charge of our data and information landscape. As an Information & Data Domain Owner, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of information and data management across Scania’s finance and IT organization.
   

  

 Who are you?
   

  

 To thrive in this role, you can act as a project manager with an eye for what needs to get done to shift focus and change minds within our global finance community. You are also a specialist with proven experience in the area of information and data including e.g. data governance, data quality management, and information modeling, to guide both data/information owners as well as senior managers.
   

  

 You should be comfortable navigating and networking in large and global organisations. You leverage your drive and communication skills as a true change-maker. For example, you are not opposed to facilitating, influencing, and negotiating in a, sometimes, high-paced environment.
   

  

 We believe your approach is pragmatic and situation-based with the capability to navigate a number of large transformation initiatives that all have a need and impact related to data. We think that you may have worked in different architecture roles and have a track record of tight collaboration with business process owners, understanding their challenges Overall, you will benefit from a large portion of team spirit, and change awareness combined with self-confidence.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

  

* Drive the area of Data & Information: Champion data quality and compliance within the finance domain. Take ownership and monitor governance processes to maintain data accuracy and reliability.
* Chair the Information Domain Council: Lead the council’s initiatives by planning, executing, and following up on actions. Facilitate meetings, coordinate presenters, and meticulously document decisions.
